title: MongoDB Databases & Collections
subject: MongoDB
theory: In MongoDB, databases hold collections of documents. You don't always need to explicitly create them; inserting data into a non-existent database or collection will create it automatically.

examples.explanation: Switches to 'school' DB (creates if missing) and inserts into 'students' collection (creates if missing).

common_mistakes.mistake: Expecting an empty database to be saved
common_mistakes.correction: MongoDB creates the database file only when the first document is inserted.

interview_questions.question: How do you drop a database?

practice_problems.problem: Create a database 'inventory' and a collection 'items'.

summary: Managing databases and collections is the first step in organizing your data.
